author: dimitri777
title: Onboarding Sri Lanka
description: Sri Lanka is completely unaware of Cardano, and more so about Catalyst. There are a few with ADA but no awareness of Catalyst benefits.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a helpful suggestion. This proposal will enable many people who have become onboarded, to be motivated to learn by incentivizing them by native tokens. the prospect once onboarded also becomes a chance to be an influencer and earn native tokens for bringing more people on board. They also become referrers for all the projects and proposals submitted by their referees. As such they can earn a good return if their referee's project gets funding. By using native tokens people are motivated and incentivized to learn effectively. This system can be used in any educational, or corporate setting, or even NGOs or government institutionst to get people to work more effectively. With the above positive effects, I believe that this project has effectively solved the challenge posed.
f6_assessments.q1:
Team information has been provided. Your team consists of many members, they are experienced in many fields such as: translation, business, blockchain, society,... . Based on that, we can have complete confidence in the ability of this project. In addition, links to their Linkedin profiles are provided. This increases the transparency of the above information.
A detailed roadmap has been provided. You've identified what needs to be done and allotted it to specific timelines, which is essential. Although the budget has been calculated, it is still vague and unclear. I think you need to split the budget further. Here I have a few suggestions that might help you: how many people will be involved in each job? how many working hours? how much is the pay per hour?... . Having a specific budget, will increase the credibility of the project, people will know how the $ 40,500 money is used. Criteria for assessing project progress and success have been provided. However, I think there should be specific metrics that PAs can rely on to monitor and evaluate the success of the project. For example, on average each post will have 2000 views, 100 comments, 50 shares,...
f6_assessments.q2: Although the information provided is not really complete, in terms of ideas, this proposal has solved the challenge posed, bringing a significant benefit to the community. For the project to run smoothly, you need to add and clarify the issues that I mentioned in the previous section. One of the plus points of the proposal is that you have identified the risk, the challenge, and how to mitigate it. This will help the project develop sustainably in the long-term roadmap. This is a useful suggestion, don't give up, hope to see you again in the next funds.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

f6_assessments.q0: I see this proposal having an impact on the Cardano ecosystem. They wanted to create a comprehensive aggregator process for all ages comfortable with Cardano and Catalyst recommendation building by defining how to reach specific groups and social media channels to reach them. Through native tokens, each influencer is incentivized to reach new leads and they will bring in more new leads and earn a profit if their referee's project sponsored by. However, they should add what results their project produces and whether it is consistent and in sync with the challenge's KPIs/Key metrics. The group gave challenges and 5 approaches to target groups, and besides, the main difficulties and risks from the volatility of ADA coin and they also came up with 2 measures to minimize this risk. but they need more detail on this.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, the team came up with a detailed plan of the three milestones. The timeline is set over 3 months with a lot of work to do, however, they need to show more what will be achieved at each stage so everyone can see how far the project is going. The team estimates a total budget of $40,500 including operations and contingencies, but they need more detail on the expenses, and I haven't seen how much it costs to pay staff and calculate hourly or monthly salaries. The team consisted of 5 people, including Dimitri Fernando, Muttiah Duraiswamy, Ruan Vukich Technical Lead, Rishantha Welikadage and Chamarie Ranasinghe. Although the team has people who have participated in the proposal in Fund9, but they have not given the main positions of these people, I do not know what responsibility each person will receive in this project even though they are all people who have extensive experience in their field of activity.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the auditability, to track the progress of the project, the team measures 3 things: the number of segments identified, the number of marketing campaigns for these segments started, and how many customers there are. New potential from these campaigns through 9 quantitative indicators. However, the team needs to state how they calculated them or if there are any other metrics that will affect the results. Next is a picture of the success of the project, they provide criteria to evaluate from reaching all target groups to creating a dynamic fast-growing culture where all are work and are encouraged for their active work. But, I need them to provide more, whether there are other proposals under the same project that have been funded, or are being called in this round so that people have grounds to believe in the success of this project.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

f6_assessments.q0:
"The emergence of cryptocurrencies and blockchain technology has offered tremendous opportunities in terms of money and career for many people. However, a majority of people in Third World Countries have not been aware of these technological advancements. In accordance with the blockchain spirit, which is the people equity, I do agree with the idea of onboarding the Cardano (and Catalyst) knowledge into Sri Lanka. 
The proposers clearly described the onboarding procedures as well as the approaching methods in detail. The interesting idea is that recruit early adopters and form a promoter/influencer network. In terms of the risks, the proposers had listed out quite sufficiently and already had the plan to them. However, the most major risk, in my opinion, is that the acceptance of the citizens to Cardano ecosystem does not meet expectations of the proposers. 
This success of this project can significantly boost the users (from Sri Lanka) into the Cardano ecosystem. From this point of view, the solution is perfectly aligned with the challenge. From my perspective, the project could even be better in a global scale. All citizens in the world have the access to the knowledge regarding to blockchain technology or Cardano ecosystem. 
"
f6_assessments.q1: The provided roadmap and planning were clear, I just could not find the precise project implementation date, though. The budget breakdown was given. It could be more fulfilling if the proposers allocated the costs according to the roadmap and planning provided. I do not have any other advice in this section because the team members were just enough and had solid experience in both business and blockchain.
f6_assessments.q2: I considered the quantity of KPIs, and metrics presented to be sufficient. I do, however, think that simply mentioning the KPIs wasn't enough, and I encourage the proposers to include provide the precise number of KPIs/metrics they intend to achieve in a specific amount of time, as well as the methods by which they would be monitored. For instance, there will be three marketing campaigns three months. In each campaign, there will be at least 100 shares and 5000 views/video post. Additionally, it could be beneficial for the community if news or notifications regarding the status of the project were provided there.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

f6_assessments.q0:
From what the proposer states it seems that he aims to grow the awareness of the Sri Lanka community to what Cardano ecosystem means and in special "Catalyst proposal building" for kids to senior citizens using a incentives system based on a token issued on Cardano blockchain (which is the subject of another proposal). Based on this it barely finds a spot into the Campaign settings as it is just tangential with the creation of a Dapp that is to be used in this proposal.

Also the presented KPIs/metrics look like they are not aligned with the one sin the Campaign mentioned above (is there to increase the quality of an existing product? how?)

Because the alignment with the actual Campaign settings is not fully met I rate this section with 3 stars.
f6_assessments.q1:
The requested budget of $40500 is broken into items but is difficult to understand for what the money will be spent. There is a total of $25k requested for "marketing campaigns for each group" but is unclear for how many groups is this amount necessary and how many people a group has, thus is difficult to assses if this requested amount is reasoable to achieve the set goals or not. The proposer should also explain what is to be done (in terms of activities - hourly rate X estimated working hours) and what is the output of the activities.
The rest of the budget items needs also explanations to make it clear for any outsider how these funds are spent.

The team consists of 5 members but it is unclear how many of them will be involved in this proposal as they do possess experience (at the statement level) in various areas. The proposer states that "the number of people required to complete this task has been calculated" but doesn't share the result with the community.

The presented roadmap will last for 3 months and each month will have milestones to achieve and it presents, to a satisfactory level of details, what is to be done but is unclear by who.

The proposer is aware of the risks that could threat the implementation of this proposal (5 of them) but it only address the high volatility, translated to FIAT, of the ADA cryptocurrency. The proposer should present a solution to mitigate the other risks too. (online meetings if another COVID wave arise etc.)
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer has identified KPIs/metrics necessary to measure the success of this proposal but some of them need better explanation (what is a segment and how many segments are relevant for the success of this proposal?) Also some of them should have a value to make a difference (how many followers for the YT channel are enough for considering a successful implementation? etc.)

The roadmap is presented to a satisfactory level. There is no evidence that the proposer has set one or more public channels for the community to track the progress of this proposal (Discord, Telegram, Twitter etc.)

Because there is no clear and understandable solution to the identified problem and other auditability aspects need improvement I rate this section with 2 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal would be better suited for a region specific challenge setting. It targets Sri Lanka and not a particular DApp or product. Sri Lanka has a young, dynamic population looking for new ways to bank and govern, and could be a great place for Cardano. Without a proposed proof of concept product or DApp, this looks more like a community effort. The proposal mentions all kinds of demographics, but not any possible directions for the tech implementation. Where is almost takes shapes, it veers off again (“Native Token or any other incentivization plan”). So this is essentially a Catalyst recruitment drive.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has a rough breakdown for the $40500 budget that I find hard to understand. The milestones are good, with a three phase plan to find a cohort, put them through Catalyst School, and then let them become proposers. The five proposers are Sri Lankans with presumably good local knowledge, blockchain knowledge and deep involvement in the Catalyst community. These are all strong points.  Creation of Native Token is under a separate proposal. I find that frustrating. This could have been a lot more feasible if it had narrowed down its goals and focused on a specific idea or direction.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a lot of KPIs and possible performance metrics. They are as broad and general as the proposal as a whole. There are no quantitative goals associated with any metric. The team should be easy to contact and is likely to report frequently. More could be done to make the project ambitious and measure its success. I suggest creating a specific direction or project for its first cohort, and then writing the proposal to fit the challenge more closely with easily understandable metrics and milestones.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great and super valid for Cardano, it's about adding more native Sri Lankans to our community, from different social groups, age groups, etc. It is said that in the country little is known about Cardano/Catalyst, even if some people hold Ada, they do not make the best use of our currency. In my view, the explanation of how this theory would be put into practice is somewhat precarious. A few things are mentioned, for example: “We will reach different market segments and audiences using highly targeted marketing campaigns”. What would these marketing campaigns look like? The proponent explains what the influencer system would look like (“Through native tokens, each influencer is incentivized to onboard new prospects and they in turn will bring in more new prospects”), but in my view the explanations are a little too short and lacking in detail. Despite being something interesting, there is not so much confidence in the impact, due to the absence of these more detailed explanations.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the script is quite adequate. We know very well how the activities would develop, I would like the same number of details to be provided for part of the impact. The proponent breaks the timeline into months and explains at length what would happen in each of them, which I believe is the best way to comment on the script. When it comes to the budget, the explanation falls short, as we know only superficially how the total amount would be divided (“creation of marketing campaigns for each group 25,000 USD. the creation of Native Token is under a separate proposal + costs creation of marketing plans and project management 12,000 USD + contingency 3500”, etc). Note that the parts themselves are quite expensive, so, in my view, they would need to be better argued. The authors are concerned with providing super long explanations about themselves, we know a lot of information about their professional trajectories, and with so much detail this part is ideal.
f6_assessments.q2: Progress can be measured through various KPIs: “Number of new prospects who become influencers, Amount of time for each influencer to learn and then start reaching out to others, Amount of native tokens earned by each influencer” etc. What concerns me is how the proponent will keep us up to date on the activities explained in the roadmap. He explains very well about the task schedule, so we do have material to audit. We just need to know better through which platform we would do this. A lot of information is also passed on about the auditability of success, but the question remains the same: where will all this be presented to our community? How will it become palpable, measurable, understood by the entire Cardano community?

solution: Create a comprehensive onboarding process for kids to senior citizens to become comfortable with Cardano and Catalyst proposal building.
experience: From age of 10 , participating in multiple societies and groups over 38 years period, and onboarding diverse stakeholders and groups into groups and enabling them to be comfortable with the values of the group. Now doing the same with Catalyst, bringing new people to Catalyst.
